metadata.title: CVE-2020-1935 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description: In Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.30, 8.5.0 to 8.5.50 and 7.0.0 to 7.0.99the HTTP header parsing code used an approach to end-of-line parsing thatallowed some invalid HTTP headers to be parsed as valid. This led to apossibility of HTTP Request Smuggling if Tomcat was located behind areverse proxy that incorrectly handled the invalid Transfer-Encoding headerin a particular manner. Such a reverse proxy is considered unlikely.

criterions.comment: tomcat9: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
tomcat8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
tomcat7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
